sn35.82:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn35.82:5.1: “Sir, they speak of this person called ‘the world’.
sn35.82:5.3: “It wears away, mendicant, that’s why it’s called ‘the world’.
sn35.82:5.6: Sights … eye consciousness … eye contact is wearing away. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also wearing away.
sn35.82:5.8: The mind … phenomena … mind consciousness … mind contact is wearing away. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also wearing away.
sn35.82:5.9: It wears away, mendicant, that’s why it’s called ‘the world’.”
